title: Fragment, 1850–1900
medium: Technique: roller-printed on cotton plain weave foundation.  Two rows of blue weft indicating the fabric heading.
inscribed: Printed at bottom upside down to heading on the front, " THOs CLARKSON & Co FURNITURE PRINTER TO HER MAJESTY, HIS ROYAL HIGHNESS THE PRINCE OF WALES" within frame, in brown.
dimensions:
Warp: 8cm (3 1/4in.) Weft: 66cm (26in.). Both selvedges present.
Pattern: Height of repeat:5.5cm (2 1/4in.) Width: 3.8cm (1 1/2in.)                  Arranged as a half-drop.
description: Design of brown dots arranged in squiggle formation on a natural background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 1850–1900.
1850–1900. Technique: roller-printed on cotton plain weave foundation.  Two rows of blue weft indicating the fabric heading.. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-19.
